physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient is alert, oriented, in no acute distress. HEENT: Sclera anicteric, dry mucous membranes, oropharynx clear. Lungs clear to auscultation bilaterally. Cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, or gallops. Abdomen: Moderately firm, non-tender, moderately distended, bowel sounds present, no rebound tenderness or guarding, no organomegaly. Extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ pulses, no clubbing or cyanosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient felt much better post-transfer and was able to eat a sandwich for the first time since presentation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ultrasound of the abdomen: The liver is homogeneous, main portal vein patent, intrahepatic bile ducts normal, gallbladder unremarkable, pancreas grossly unremarkable, kidneys normal size with a parenchymal scar in the right kidney.
